title: Mobile vs immobile champ dmg.
body: How come mobile champs are allowed to do more dmg than most immobile champs? Why can yasuo both out dmg and block and shield dmg from an annie?  Why can Camille jump around the map and deal more true dmg to a target than darius with full stacked ult?why is this allowed design wise?

replies.body:
Because Riot has statistics that say mobile champions are more fun than immobile champions, so keeping those champions more powerful will keep players playing them and having more fun while playing the game.

Riot knows exactly what they're doing, even if they won't admit it.

Look at the era of Lee Sin where he did too much damage for his durability and mobility. It’s exactly the same thing.
Popular champs get more attention which keeps them popular.

Zed's ult-E-auto can deal enough damage to kill most squishies once he gets duskblade and youmuu's. He doesn't need to land a single shuriken because he already has more than enough damage from alternate sources (electrocute, cut down, etc) to do the work for him.

Leblanc has always been stupid. Her rework was much better but her mains missed being able to play her without using a reasonable amount of brain capacity and select meta ADCs were out-bursting her prior to the crit rework so she got reverted back to the uninteractive ball of burst she is now.
Zed theoretically can do that, but if that adc has any brain function, he'll be with his support forcing Zed to throw Q that you can, i repeat, dodge..

I'm not going to argue theoretical scenarios here. Every game is different, and every outcome is different. 

All I am saying is Zed and other assassins have access to too many sources of damage that are not what was supposed to be their main abilities. 

Zed used to have to pull off some sick multi-shurikens to land that kill. Leblanc had to use more than 2 abilities (Until the 700 AP mark). Fizz had to actually follow up on his ult. Talon relied on actually dodging abilities with his blink, and his W was a bigger damage source (though he was still a bit too strong  he wasn't 100-0ing at level 2). Kha'Zix didn't make people disappear unless they were stupid enough to wander into his jungle if he was fed. And Rengar is back to his old one-shotting self.

Assassins on average have grown more uninteractive, more volatile, and they avalanche rather than snowball. They take agency out of the game without much effort because only they can utilize tools that Riot keeps buffing every few patches.

It isn't just that simple, and when champions have something, they tend to lose other things. Damage is relative, and it all depends on who is more ahead, a fed Annie is going to one shot a Yasou outright, period, no discussion there, but a fed Yasou is going to dash around the battlefield doing whatever he pleases. Annie doesn't get mobility but instead gets consistent hard CC that she doesn't have to aim and thus, far more team utility.

Also no, Camille is NEVER going to do more true damage then a Darius, maybe if the game is over quickly because she gets hers at lvl 1 to his level 6, but in no world in the long run is a Camille going to out true damage a Darius.

Mobile champs that actually deal damage(not including supports and tanks) don't have much utility. If you take a look at damage dealers with mobility:Zed has a shitty slow, Katarina has nothing,Talon has a shitty slow, Yasuo has a knock up , Rengar has a root that he needs to sacrifice damage in order to use it or a slow, kha'zix has a slow only if he evolves his w,Graves has no cc, Akali has a slow in her w that is barely even usable,Diana has a small knock up etc.
If you take a look at purely immobile champs:Lux has a bit of a slow, a root and a shield, syndra has a stun and a slow,Cassiopeia has a slow, a root and a stun,TF has a point and click stun with an ult that gives vision,veigar has a stun which is also a zoning tool, Orianna has a shield, a slow and a knockup(or w/e the hell shockwave counts as),Fiddle has a fear and a silence and so it goes on.
There are a few exceptions, like ekko and irelia who are mobile, do a lot of damage and also have cc, but those are just awful designs.
And after all, most of the time the damage output of both categories is the same, unless someone gets fed. You may think that zed does more damage than per say orianna, but zed does his one rotation in a teamfight and then does nothing for the rest of it, while orianna has a 1.5 second cd q that she can spam during the fight as well as her other abilities.

Because damage and mobility aren't the only two factors in a champion. I always think about it like a triangle of balance. At each corner is one of each: Damage, Mobility, Utility. One could arguable say it's a square with one point being tankiness, but I prefer to lump that in with utility. Champions with high damage and mobility generally have very little utility. Leblanc has a root in her chain, and that is the extent of her utility. Talon has a slow on his W, but is otherwise all damage and mobility. Yasuo has windwall, which is pretty high utility but balanced with a very long cooldown on a champion that doesn't usually want CDR, and is generally pretty squishy. (Say what you will about yasuo, if he gets rooted or stunned late game, he dies fast).
